title: Key Texts from the Nag Hammadi Library

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the key texts from the Nag Hammadi Library discussed in this module?
questions.answer: The Gospel of Mary

questions.question: What is the main focus of The Gospel of Thomas?
choices: A narrative of Jesus' life and ministry
A collection of sayings attributed to Jesus
questions.answer: A collection of sayings attributed to Jesus

questions.question: How many sayings are attributed to Jesus in The Gospel of Thomas?
What is the central theme in The Gospel of Thomas regarding salvation?
questions.answer: Self-knowledge and inner wisdom

questions.question: Which text presents a complex Gnostic cosmology and creation myth?
questions.answer: The Secret Book of John

questions.question: What is another name for The Secret Book of John?
questions.answer: The Apocryphon of John

questions.question: In Gnostic thought, what is the Demiurge?
questions.answer: An imperfect creator god

questions.question: What does the term 'Pleroma' refer to in Gnostic texts?
choices: The fullness of the divine realm
questions.answer: The fullness of the divine realm

questions.question: What is the main focus of The Gospel of Philip?
questions.answer: Sacramental theology and spiritual marriage

questions.question: How does The Gospel of Philip interpret the concept of resurrection?
choices: As a physical event at the end of time
As a spiritual rather than physical event
questions.answer: As a spiritual rather than physical event

questions.question: What is 'gnosis' in the context of Gnostic thought?
questions.answer: Esoteric knowledge leading to salvation

questions.question: What do Gnostic texts often refer to as being trapped within humans in the material world?
questions.answer: A divine spark

questions.question: In Gnostic cosmology, what are Archons?
choices: Malevolent rulers of the material world
questions.answer: Malevolent rulers of the material world

questions.question: How is Sophia typically portrayed in Gnostic texts?
choices: As divine wisdom, often personified as feminine
questions.answer: As divine wisdom, often personified as feminine

questions.question: What are Aeons in Gnostic thought?
choices: Divine emanations or attributes of God
questions.answer: Divine emanations or attributes of God

questions.question: How many leather-bound papyrus codices were discovered at Nag Hammadi?
How many texts were contained in the Nag Hammadi library?
In what year was the Nag Hammadi library discovered?
What is the significance of the Nag Hammadi texts for understanding early Christianity?
choices: They prove the accuracy of the canonical gospels
They reveal the existence of alternative interpretations of Jesus' teachings
They disprove the existence of Jesus
They confirm the unity of early Christian thought
questions.answer: They reveal the existence of alternative interpretations of Jesus' teachings

questions.question: How does The Secret Book of John interpret the Genesis creation story?
choices: It presents a radically different interpretation
It ignores the creation story entirely
It merges it with Greek mythology
questions.answer: It presents a radically different interpretation

questions.question: What concept does The Gospel of Philip use as a metaphor for the union of the human soul with the divine?
questions.answer: The bridal chamber

questions.question: How do the Nag Hammadi texts challenge traditional Christian understandings?
choices: By presenting alternative visions of Christian spirituality
By denying the existence of Jesus
questions.answer: By presenting alternative visions of Christian spirituality

questions.question: What philosophical traditions are reflected in the Nag Hammadi texts?
choices: Greek philosophy and Jewish wisdom literature
questions.answer: Greek philosophy and Jewish wisdom literature

questions.question: What is the primary focus of hermeneutical approaches to Gnostic literature?
choices: Interpretation and understanding of the texts
questions.answer: Interpretation and understanding of the texts

questions.question: Which hermeneutical approach emphasizes hidden or symbolic meanings in Gnostic texts?
questions.answer: Allegorical interpretation

questions.question: What is the purpose of the creative writing exercise in the lesson plan?
choices: To compose a short 'Gnostic' text addressing a contemporary Timorese issue
To rewrite one of the Nag Hammadi texts
To write a research paper on Gnosticism
questions.answer: To compose a short 'Gnostic' text addressing a contemporary Timorese issue

questions.question: What is the main objective of comparing Gnostic concepts with Timorese traditional beliefs?
choices: To prove that Gnosticism influenced Timorese culture
To show the superiority of Gnostic thought
To encourage critical thinking and cultural reflection
To convert Timorese people to Gnosticism
questions.answer: To encourage critical thinking and cultural reflection

questions.question: What type of knowledge does Gnosticism emphasize as leading to salvation?
questions.answer: Experiential and esoteric knowledge

questions.question: How does the Gnostic view of the material world differ from orthodox Christian views?
choices: Gnostics see the material world as perfect
Gnostics view the material world as a flawed creation of the Demiurge
Gnostics and orthodox Christians have identical views
Gnostics deny the existence of the material world
questions.answer: Gnostics view the material world as a flawed creation of the Demiurge

questions.question: What is the significance of studying these ancient Gnostic texts in the Timorese context?
choices: To prove the historical accuracy of Timorese myths
To encourage reflection on knowledge, spirituality, and cultural identity
To establish Gnosticism as the official religion of Timor-Leste
questions.answer: To encourage reflection on knowledge, spirituality, and cultural identity
